Part of the central Data Platform organization, the Experimentation Platform team focuses on making product experimentation faster and more robust for Discord. We develop and operate an end-to-end platform that is leveraged by our Machine Learning, Analytics, Engineering and Product partners.We are looking for strong software engineers who want to help build Discord's next generation experimentation platform. Our work is foundational to company and product strategy — to learn more about Discord Engineering in general, read our engineering blog here!If the above sounds exciting to you, read on! What you will do  Lead the effort to design, build, and support Discord's next generation experimentation platform: scope of work would include core services, data storage and processing, configuration tooling and UX, etc. Drive the collaboration with external (sometimes non-technical) stakeholders and customers throughout the company. Understand and influence product telemetry practices to support experimentation needs. What you have You have 7+ years of software development experience. Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field including Computer Science, Physics, Applied Math, Statistics or other quantitative fields. You have successfully led a reasonable sized project with a group of 4+ engineers. Deep understanding of A/B testing and experimentation platforms, either through building and supporting the platform or running and analyzing experiments as a product or ranking engineer. You have strong communication skills and the ability to drive effective collaborations with leaders in product, data science, and engineering. You thrive in ambiguous environments and get excited about figuring out solutions to complex problems, and then executing on them. You have experience building and deploying large-scale distributed systems in a cloud computing environment. Experience with at least one of the following languages: Python, Java, Scala. Experience and with and/or exposure to a variety of data storages (relational, NoSQL, data warehouse solutions). Bonus Points   Experience with modern data processing stacks. Full-stack development or product engineering experience (React, Web frameworks). Deep understanding of statistics, data science, or large scale data processing. Experience with building the experimentation platform. Benefits And Perks Comprehensive medical insurance including Health, Dental and Vision (plus up to $20,000 for gender affirmation procedures)  Mental health resources and quarterly wellness stipends 19+ paid holidays, 4 weeks of PTO, use-what-you-need sick days and volunteer time off Paid parental leave (plus fertility, adoption and other family planning benefits) Generous stipends for headphones, your remote work setup, and lunch on a daily basis (while we’re all remote)  Flexible long-term work options (remote and hybrid) A diverse slate of Employee Resource Groups  Plus commuter contributions and other perks for office-based employees About Us Discord is a voice, video and text app that helps friends and communities come together to hang out and explore their interests — from artists and activists, to study groups, sneakerheads, plant parents, and more. With 150 million monthly users across 19 million active communities, called servers, Discord has grown to become one of the most popular communications services in the world. Discord was built without selling ads or user data and instead, offers a premium subscription called Nitro that gives users special perks like higher quality streams and fun customizations. In a world of polarization, social curation, and loneliness, Discord is working toward an inclusive world where no one feels like an outsider. We believe in the value of genuine human connection, which can so easily be lost online. So we’re building a space where everyone can find belonging from the inside out. If this strikes a chord with you, come build belonging with us! #LI-Remote #LI-Hybrid #LI-AR1

job_title: Data Scientist / AI / NLP / Machine Learning Engineer
job_Description: Job Description: Data Scientist / AI / NLP / Machine Learning Engineer  Mynurse.ai is on a mission to help people with chronic conditions live their healthiest lives.  Job overview  As a Data Scientist / AI / NLP / Machine Learning Engineer, you will work closely with mynurse.ai’s CTO, engineering, product teams, and internal stakeholders, to advance AI, NLP and machine learning development efforts providing interventions analysis, AI driven coaching and recommendations, and real time conversational analysis.  As an AI expert, you will research new approaches and architectures in AI, supporting the analysis of medical narratives, transcribed patient encounters and vitals analysis, ensuring the development and deployment of machine learning and deep learning models into live production systems, while supporting on-going operational analytics using machine learning and data science techniques.  Your impact:  You will directly contribute to mynurse.ai’s Artificial Intelligence and Data Science development efforts in the areas of conversational, coaching, operational, and interventions analysis, meeting the needs of our rapidly growing and diverse customer base.  You are passionate about:   Developing product that improves the health of our society. Researching, implementing and deploying new deep learning architectures and topologies to address different machine learning tasks Designing and developing infrastructure for collecting high-quality labels from clinical datasets  Working with other data scientists, and data engineers to advance AI development efforts  Utilizing machine learning and data science techniques to develop analytical products for operational and decision support  Working with product teams to code, train, test and deploy production-grade machine learning systems  Continuously developing AI know-how and assets for the company You have a minimum of:  PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, AI, NLP, Deep Learning, Data Science  Deep understanding of machine learning and AI, specifically in neural networks, classification and regression, clustering, feature representations and feature engineering  Experience with attention networks, sequence to sequence, encoder-decoder models, transformers, and/or graphical neural networks  Good mathematical understanding of popular NLP and Machine Learning algorithms  Understanding of multivariate statistics and statistical inference  Knowledge of relational database concepts, data mining, data warehouses, decision support tools including SQL and NoSQL  Strong software engineering skills in Python, PyTorch, and Javascript  Ability to multi-task effectively in a fast-paced environment  High responsiveness and flexibility to changing business priorities and tight deadlines  High level of enthusiasm and desire to learn  Track record of machine learning algorithms that are deployed and in production, specifically in natural language processing a bonus  Benefits:   Competitive salary  Stock options  Flexible vacation to help you rest, recharge, and connect with loved ones  Parental leave  Health, dental, and vision insurance  Remote first work environment And more!   About mynurse.ai:  Mynurse.ai is a conversational AI and digital care provider that helps people achieve their health goals through sustainable behavioral change. Working with physicians, payors, and individuals, the company delivers personalized interventions for individuals with chronic conditions. Combining data-powered human coaching, connected devices, and curriculums tailored to an individual's specific conditions and circumstances, mynurse.ai has developed strong partnerships and customers including UCSF Rosenman Institute, Sutter Health IPA, DreamIt Health and Unitedhealth Group.  We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Mynurse.ai is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender, identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.  Apply for this position

PhD in Economics or highly related field (Marketing, Finance, Statistics, Math)  10+ years of experience in industry, consulting, government, or academic research  Experience in applied economic analysis and with big data and machine learning or data science  Coding ability in a scripting language such as R, Python, Matlab, or STATA  Job summary Core AI is an interdisciplinary team on the cutting edge of economics, statistical analysis, and machine learning whose mission is to solve AI and ML problems that have high risk with abnormally high returns. Through our efforts we seek to understand and design Amazon's complex network of buyers and sellers, while also leveraging the strengths of our engineers and scientists to build solutions for some of the toughest business problems here at Amazon. We are looking for a seasoned principal economist who is able to provide structure, including sourcing, defining, and leveling, around complex and varied business problems. We seek creative thinkers who can combine a strong economic toolbox with a desire to learn from others, and who know how to execute and deliver on big ideas. This role is to work within the Core AI team in two key ways. The first is working with Amazon's Scholar Residency Program, which consists of world-class academic scientists and researchers collaborating with internal partner teams to facilitate the delivery of Scholar led science into engineering systems. The second is to leverage data, engineering, and science on rapid proofs of concept while filling gaps that may arise for both the Scholars program and other Core AI initiatives. Responsibilities  Work with Scholars and other Core AI teams to consult with internal partner terms on collaboration opportunities and to assess potential for impact.  Own the development of economic models and manage the data analysis, modeling, and experimentation necessary to validate your model.  Effectively communicate econometric models to business teams and incorporate feedback into project analysis/modeling.  Strong research track record, drives results  Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution  Effective verbal and written communications skills  Exhibits business judgment  Has relentlessly high standards  Dives deep, thinks big and has convictions  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

job_title: Director of Product Management, Member Homepage Personalization
job_Description: Los Gatos, California Product Management The Role With more than 200 million members in over 190 countries, Netflix continues to shape the future of entertainment around the world. Personalization permeates almost every aspect of the Netflix product experience: From adapting the UI’s layout to member tastes, recommending the most delightful content, to showing the most helpful title images and trailers to help members choose better - machine learning is essential to how members enjoy our service. We are looking for a Director of Product Innovation to both advance our existing personalization capabilities in the member experience and to build new algorithmically powered experiences that will delight our members. This role will primarily be focused on the Netflix Homepage - the most important and prominent destination in our member product. Leveraging available data, you will craft and communicate a strategic roadmap and see to its execution leading cross-functional teams of the industry’s best data scientists, machine learning and software engineers. You will work in close partnership with UI product management, design, consumer insights and other functions to bring your vision to life and drive transformational change of the product experience. As a high-leverage thought leader, you will have the ability to shape our thinking on how to evolve our product, and have a massive impact on how members enjoy our service. Who will be successful in this role? You combine a deep technical background in e.g. statistics, econometrics, or machine learning with a strong product sense and excellent communication skills to define, explain and execute your vision. You naturally gravitate towards experimentation as a way to validate your hypotheses while having a healthy skepticism when interpreting experimental results. In order to be successful in this position, you need to be able to work with world-class engineers, have the statistical acumen to collaborate with top-notch data scientists and the business sense to drive product goals and strategies. Demonstrated ability to build successful consumer facing applications and algorithms, and a strong feel for movie/TV content are big pluses. What we offer The opportunity to have impact. The Netflix product management model is different from most technology companies. Our key product management leaders - including this position - work with multiple sprint teams but do not have direct reports. Consequently, we’re looking for experienced product leaders who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. Responsibility. Netflix offers true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate. Learning. You will be creating customer experiences and business models that have never been done before. You will have the opportunity to work with stunning colleagues who value collaboration and from whom you can learn. A work environment where you can grow your career. Many of our top execs started out as individual contributors. Skills Experience managing consumer products leveraging machine learning (e.g. recommendation systems) with a proven record of prioritizing and successfully launching impactful products or platforms. Extensive experience and demonstrated leadership working effectively with data scientists, machine learning engineers, statisticians etc. Proven ability to map algorithmic solutions to product problems with demonstrated impact on business metrics through AB testing. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to present technical content to non-technical audiences. Ability to partner with different functions to ensure that your solutions drive real business impact. Strategic thinking and ability to incorporate larger business context into algorithm and product development. Post graduate education (MS or PhD) in an applied quantitative field strongly preferred, such as : Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations research, Information theory, Control theory, Econometrics etc. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and backgrounds will lead to a better environment for our employees and better products for our customers. APPLY NOW  Share this listing:  LINK COPIED

Requisition ID: R10016357  Category:  Engineering Location:  Woodland Hills - CA, United States of America Citizenship Required:  United States Citizenship Clearance Type:  Secret Telecommute:  Yes- May Consider Occasional/Part-Time Teleworking for this position Shift:  1st Shift (United States of America) Travel Required:  Yes, 10% of the Time Positions Available:  1   At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is a trusted provider of mission-enabling solutions for global security. Our Engineering and Sciences (E&S) organization pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines engineering capabilities, and drives advances in various sciences. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to develop, design, produce and sustain optimized product lines across the sector while providing a decisive advantage to the warfighter. Come be a part of our mission! The Future Position Navigation and Timing (FPNT) Research and Development team at Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as a Staff Research Development Engineer based out of Woodland Hills, CA. What You’ll get to Do: Work with a team of navigation and timing experts in a team-based collaborative environment dedicated to advancing the state of the art in navigation. Work in close collaboration with Government Customers to develop advanced navigation and timing technologies, and support transition of those technologies to production. Provide technical leadership for Internal Northrop Grumman R&D projects. Apply your research and development skills to build real-world products and capabilities well beyond purely academic or theoretical. Work on next generation applications like autonomous navigation, distributed sensing, proliferate low earth orbit (P-LEO) space systems, model-based system engineering, cloud-based software as a service, swarming vehicles, artificial intelligence/machine learning, and signal integrity. Design and develop navigation warfare techniques, algorithms, and software to enhance mission success in contested environments. Analyze large quantities of sensor data to uncover, understand, and exploit complex phenomenology. Prototype algorithms in MATLAB, Python, C, and/or C++ and test algorithm performance. Apply ML and AI techniques to improve existing and newly developed algorithms. Collaborate with multiple functional teams to facilitate algorithm implementation in real-time code. Present your ideas to internal and external groups; lead proposal activities; and represent Northrop Grumman at technical conferences and working groups. NGFeaturedJobs Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, or related technical discipline with 14 years of related technical experience, or 12 years with Master’s Degree, or 9 years with PhD. Demonstrated success in solving complex problems in broad domains of expertise. Demonstrated proficiency leveraging math and statistical techniques to solve difficult technical problems. Demonstrated experience designing, testing, and implementing complex algorithms solutions. Experience with MATLAB/Simulink, C/C++, and/or Python. Comfortable with loosely-defined problems, have a demonstrated ability to think creatively, and draw upon a variety of sources for ideas and solutions. Demonstrated technical leadership of programs and/or proposals in a collaborative environment to propose, plan, estimate, organize, and integrate Systems Engineering activities across multiple engineering disciplines. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including interfacing with Customers. Demonstrated experience in preparing concept papers, briefings, trade studies, white papers, proposals, or similar documents for internal and external stakeholders. Self-motivated, capable of working independently as well as within a team structure. Must be a U.S. citizen with the ability to obtain a DoD clearance. Preferred Qualifications:   Experience in any of the following areas is highly desired: data analysis, artificial intelligence/machine learning, signal processing techniques, statistical decision theory, celestial navigation, stellar navigation, vision-aided navigation, signal integrity, navigation sensor fusion. General knowledge of databases, and the optimization of algorithms for database usage. Proficiency with MATLAB/Simulink, C/C++, and/or Python. Demonstrated knowledge of principles of navigation, including inertial navigation, aided navigation, and Kalman filtering. Demonstrated track record of innovation and accomplishment in the field of navigation and timing. Self-motivated and independently able to develop innovative approaches to diverse technical challenges and see them through to realization. Ability to effectively motivate people to work as an integrated team across sites, companies and cultures. Ability to use Model-based Systems Engineering (MBSE) tools and concepts to define functions and develop functional and performance requirements. Experience working in an Agile team environment. Experience working in a Research and Development environment. Demonstrated mentorship of others. Active DoD security clearance with current background investigation.   Salary Range:  155600 - 233400   Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.   The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority. With the continuing impacts of COVID-19 around the world, we are taking action to protect the health and well-being of our colleagues and maintain the safety of the communities where we operate. As a federal contractor, and consistent with  Executive Order 14042  (https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/) we will require all newly hired employees in the United States to be fully vaccinated by January 18, 2022 or by your start date if it is after January 18th. Federal guidance allows for disability/medical and religious accommodations with respect to the vaccine requirement. Any requested accommodations must be reviewed and approved (if applicable) in advance of your start date. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

About Oracle CX Sales and Sales Automation Oracle Sales guides sellers with intelligent recommendations to help them focus on the most valuable prospects at the right time. These machine learning-based CRM selling tools center around clean, complete customer data from internal and external sources that sellers can trust. Oracle Sales Automation provides sellers with clean and complete customer data, recommendations to guide their actions, data-driven quotas and territories, and easy-to-use account management features that help sellers sell more. This comprehensive set of tools, with machine learning and advanced automation and capabilities, reduces complexity and increases the amount of time spent selling. About the Opportunity We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Data Science team at Oracle CX Sales. Focus for this team: evaluate business outcomes that customers can achieve by using Oracle CX Sales products; recommend innovations, product variants, positioning, improvements; generate and test hypotheses to answer business questions; develop best practices; establish proof points. This role allows for the opportunity to combine world-class data, data science, and storytelling. Oracle CX Sales products are made possible because of massive data sets, high engineering standards, and advanced data science. As a Data Scientist within the Data Science team, you will lead applied research projects and communicate findings to inform product development strategy. To be successful in this role you must: apply advanced statistical methods; create new methods, solutions, and insights, and demonstrate their value. About the Role This role will be one of the earliest hires in the Oracle CX Sales data science team. Our team is mandated to build the next-generation insights into Oracle CX Sales - which means, pragmatically solving the existing and known problems as well as conducting efficient R&D to identify and solve the untapped problem space to innovate within the CX Sales solution portfolio. Therefore, pushing the boundaries of existing realities will bring exposure to cutting-edge and state-of-the-art techniques alongside. This is a high growth potential role within the team and organization. What you will do As one of the first hires in the Oracle CX Sales data science team, you will help us to establish a healthy and intellectually curious culture around data science. Your day to day responsibilities will be first to curate a couple of golden datasets, to generate and test hypotheses to answer business questions; develop best practices; conduct exploratory data analysis to study and understand the data and problem space; to build machine learning pipelines - including modeling, deployment, and monitoring. You will participate in biweekly paper review sessions, contribute to the team's continuous learning culture and help to communicate low-level data science concepts to higher-level management. You will practice building machine learning systems in Oracle's machine learning platforms - OCI data science and OML. What you will bring 2+ years of industry-level experience in data science and exposure to python libraries like NumPy, Pandas, sklearn, and others. Deep understanding and intuition of computation/inference/reasoning/learning. Get-Things-Done attitude and Growth mindset. Rigorous experiment design skills and critical thinking. Programming experience: Python and SQL. Exposure to cloud platforms: AWS or OCI. Exposure to RDBMS: Oracle, PostgreSQL, or MySQL. job_title: Technical Lead Manager, Behavior Prediction, Deep Learning
job_Description: Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they’re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the World’s Most Experienced Driver in hopes of improving the world's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing. Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they’re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the World’s Most Experienced Driver in hopes of improving the world's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing.  Software Engineering builds the brains of Waymo's fully autonomous driving technology. Our software allows the Waymo Driver to perceive the world around it, making the right decision for every situation, and deliver people safely to their destinations. We think deeply and solve complex technical challenges in areas like robotics, perception, decision-making and deep learning, while collaborating with hardware and systems engineers. We are looking for leaders who can organize and lead a diverse group of software engineers to solve challenging technical problems.  In this role, you will:   Lead a team of software engineers working on cutting edge applied machine learning techniques to solve complex problems that arise when trying to predict the behavior of vehicles and pedestrians on the road.  Attract, grow, and retain a diversity of talent, providing technical direction and career growth opportunities  Inspire and motivate the team to work together as a cohesive and productive unit  Guide all technical aspects of development, including technical requirements definition, design, implementation, unit testing, and integration  Work closely with engineering partners and stakeholders to drive organizational alignment   Minimum Qualifications:   PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Robotics, similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience  Experience in data science including data collection, analysis, hypothesis formulation and verification  Experience in applied Machine Learning including feature engineering, model deployment, A/B testing  Experience in Deep Learning research and tools such as TensorFlow or Pytorch  Software design and development experience in Python and C++  Experience managing projects spanning across multiple teams  Experience in leading teams and setting technical direction  Experience in building diverse, inclusive and collaborative team culture  Solid written and verbal communications  History and passion for creating inclusive and respectful work environments   Preferred Qualifications:   Experience in the Self Driving Car industry  2+ years of experience as an engineering manager  Note: The following is only applicable for roles hired in the US. As we keep the safety of our employees and our communities top of mind, COVID-19 vaccinations continue to be a critical prevention measure to help end the pandemic. Because of this, Waymo requires all US-based employees who perform work onsite for Waymo to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to a disability, medical condition or religious belief, Waymo will provide a reasonable accommodation consistent with federal, state, and local law.

Los Angeles, CA Forge alternate worlds that deepen players' lives! We're a game development studio based in Los Angeles, dedicated to the idea that online games can deliver deeper, more meaningful experiences. As a Data Scientist, you’ll report to our Head of Revenue and Insights and help our studio better understand our players and their behaviors across a very broad gaming experience. Understanding user behavior is critical to Palia’s success, and Singularity 6 is invested in being at the forefront of data in the gaming space. Your work will help shape the direction of high-value projects across the entire game and studio.  Responsibilities: Collect insights around gameplay, monetization, or social features across Palia Work with raw feedback from players to understand their primary concerns and present them in a digestible framework to stakeholders Build forecasting tools and generalized models that impact decision making Determine adequate metrics and KPIs to measure product and feature performance Communicate product recommendations and general strategy to business leaders Apply best practices in analytics to build live reports that are robust and maintainable Contribute to the overall data efforts at Singularity 6, setting the bar for analytics standards and challenging technical norms  Desired Qualifications: Strong knowledge of SQL and proficiency in at least one core programming language (e.g., Python, R, Matlab, Julia, etc) Firm understanding of general concepts within statistics and probability (e.g. hypothesis testing, sampling, estimation, linear models) Ability to build creative analyses and visualizations from scratch using common tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, etc.) Experience working with and advising product leaders directly leveraging data to empower and direct decision making  Bonus Qualifications: Knowledge of cloud computing and cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, Azure) Experience with data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift), and orchestration (e.g., Airflow, Luigi) Experience working with common data platforms (e.g., Databricks, AI Platform, SageMaker) Interest in machine learning techniques Familiarity with Graph Databases (e.g., Neo4j, ArangoDB)  Location: On-site in Los Angeles, CA (once back in office) unless noted above  Benefits: Health, Vision, Dental, 401k Matching, and Equity Relocation Assistance  Job Vertical: PC and Console Games About Us With our first project, we’re exploring new styles of game design and tackling difficult technical problems to create a game that’s beautiful and intricate, delivering far more than superficial entertainment or basic wish fulfillment, an experience that becomes a meaningful part of your life. Our vision is to create a compelling virtual universe filled with rich and diverse gameplay experiences and social interactions that will keep you playing for years, evolving along with you and the rest of the community. We want our players to feel valued as well as a true sense of belonging. Sounds ambitious? We think so too. If you’re interested in the challenge of building a new genre, in making rewarding interactive and community experiences filled with amazing art and world class technology to support this living world, join us on the journey. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity, equity, and inclusion. We consider all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.  To all recruitment agencies:  Singularity 6 does not accept unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our careers alias, or any Singularity 6 employee. Singularity 6 will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes.

Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, or a related quantitative field.  Hands-on experience in developing machine learning models using Python, R, Java or other programming languages.  3+ years of relevant ML research experience in industry and/or academia.  Ability to self-direct, multitask, and prioritize a constantly evolving workload.  Extensive knowledge and practical experience in Computer Vision.  Job summary At Amazon, we strive every day to be Earth’s most customer centric company. Amazon Perfect Order Experience (POE) team works to ensure that customers can buy with confidence on Amazon. We develop and implement large scale machine learning solutions to protect the buying experience on Amazon while minimizing friction for our selling partners. We are looking for an Applied Scientist to build efficient and scalable machine learning systems to keep amazon the safest and most trusted place to shop online. In this role, you will work closely with scientists, economists and engineers to build end-to-end ML solutions that have immediate impacts on amazon customers. You will work on a variety of research areas including:  Build the next generation of risk detection system using predictive modeling, graph mining and unsupervised learning techniques  Develop NLP models to extract insights from customer feedback.  Apply the state-of-the-art Computer Vision technique to authenticate products using various sensing devices.  Build ML and DL models to increase decision automation rate and improve investigator productivity  Develop solutions to recommend products that provide best shopping experience for customers  PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, or a related quantitative field with at least 2 years of working experience as Data/Research/Applied Scientist.  Extensive experience applying theoretical models in an applied environment.  Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Description QC Ware develops quantum computing solutions for commercial and government partners through collaborative R&D engagements. We are looking for an individual to work directly with our partners to deploy and develop QC Ware’s quantum algorithms and SaaS product. This quantum engineer will tackle complex operational problems in a wide range of industries and will identify ways to apply quantum and classical algorithms to these problems. The quantum engineer will play a key role in the symbiosis between our partner-facing engagements, our product development, and our algorithmic research. ‍ Requirements Background with SaaS products Prior work on operational problems that arise in an industrial setting Experience with quantum circuit programming and hardware execution Experience with machine learning techniques and tools Research in NISQ quantum algorithms Preferred Qualifications Background with SaaS products Prior work on operational problems that arise in an industrial setting Experience with quantum circuit programming and hardware execution Experience with machine learning techniques and tools Research in NISQ quantum algorithms Minimum Qualifications Ph.D. in physics or a closely related discipline from a top research institution Published contributions in quantum computation, quantum algorithms, quantum information science, particle or condensed matter theory, or computational physics.  High level of proficiency with the Python programming language Ability to work at our office in Palo Alto, California Demonstrated interest and ability to work with varied research collaboration partners Excellent interpersonal skills and desire to work with partners and across teams Compensation Competitive cash and stock option package Health/Vision/Dental coverage for employee and dependents 401K ‍ About You About QC Ware QC Ware is a quantum computing software company building enterprise solutions that run on quantum hardware. The company also offers professional services to large enterprises that are lacking the right skills to engage in quantum computing right away. The company’s stated objective is to make quantum computing easily accessible to classically-trained data scientists and to offer performance speed-ups on near-term hardware. QC Ware is working towards that goal with one of the world’s strongest teams of quantum algorithms scientists. The company is based in Palo Alto, and it recently opened an office in Paris. QC Ware offers a very competitive salary, commission, and stock option package as well as health, vision, and dental coverage for an employee and the employee’s dependents. company: University of California Office of the President
job_Description: Location:  Oakland  Job ID:  27260 Job Posting   For UCOP internal applicants, please login to the internal candidate gateway at:  Jobs at UCOP   UC OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT  At the University of California (UC), your contributions make a difference. A world leader producing Nobel and Pulitzer prize recipients with over 150 years of groundbreaking research transforming the world. Choose a career where you can leverage your knowledge, skills and aspirations to inspire and support some of the greatest minds in the world, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Working at the University of California is being part of a unique institution, and a vibrant and diverse community. At the University of California, Office of the President, we propel our mission through impactful work locally, in government centers and systemwide. We are passionate people, serving the greater good.  The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the headquarters to the 10 campuses, six academic medical centers and three national laboratories and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world. Learn more about the UC Office of the President   DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW  At the California Digital Library (cdlb.org), we believe passionately that libraries are vitally important to students, faculty and the public. By mobilizing the expertise and creativity of a diverse community and engaging in collaborative problem-solving, we are transforming the way libraries and scholars work. Working with the University of California campus libraries and national and international library organizations, we are expanding the academy's capacity for innovation, knowledge creation, and research breakthroughs while enabling the University of California to produce a measurable impact valued by the state, the nation and the world.  The CDL is a unit within the UC Office of the President, has a staff of 70+ and is located in downtown Oakland. Applicants who wish to work remotely will be considered. This position is not available for sponsorship.   POSITION SUMMARY  As a Software Engineer at the California Digital Library, you will be developing systems using Python, Java and/or Ruby; MySQL and other databases; and Unix in an AWS environment. You will be learning and using machine learning languages and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and Scikit. And, you will be joining a team committed to software engineering best practices including Agile, test first development and user centered design.  As a member of CDL's Discovery and Delivery (D2D) team, you will be part of a team of software engineers, librarians and product managers supporting a wide variety of innovative library services. These include the UC libraries' integrated library system (UC Library Search); an interlibrary loan system and a system providing instant access to online books and journals. In addition, D2D provides collections analysis and decision support for library consortia and it develops and maintains a metadata management system for one of the world's largest digital libraries, HathiTrust. Newer projects include integrating machine learning into library systems and working with library consortia to provide more and better digital access to library materials.  This position offers an outstanding opportunity to a software engineer with a good knowledge of Python, Java and/or Ruby; a strong interest in learning machine learning languages and libraries; a commitment to good programming practices; a desire to work as part of an agile team and an interest in putting technology to work to provide innovative library services.

Minimum Qualifications: 6 years of experience with OBIEE reporting solutions and advanced knowledge of SQL, PL/SQL, relational databases, and complex data warehouses.  Tasks:  Develop standardized enterprise dashboards to meet the needs of project stakeholders and business owners ranging from executive management, team members, and multiple business units across the District. Create mock-ups of reporting solutions, scorecards, dashboards, etc. to provide visualizations for end users.  Apply advanced modeling, data mining, machine learning, and/or statistical techniques to data and dashboards to generate actionable insights enabling informed decision-making for optimized business and operational performance. Work with IT administrators, developers, project managers, business analysts, and stakeholders across multiple business units to systematically plan the launch of new and/or enhanced dashboards. Prepare launch collateral/documentation and work closely with users during UAT, production release, and postproduction phases. Create and support proactive processes to monitor dashboard availability, performance, and secure usage across production and non-production environments.  Highly Desired Knowledge and Skills: The proposed candidate should have a proven track record in multiple IT areas including database development, complex data warehousing concepts, mid-tier development & cloud services. Additionally, the candidate should have significant experience with normalization and denormalization techniques, be able to read and interpret physical data models and have knowledge of query performance tuning for complex reporting solutions. A candidate with knowledge of K-12 data systems and data warehousing is preferred.

job_title: Technical Program Manager- Applied Machine Learning - IS&T
job_Description: Summary  Posted: Nov 9, 2021  Weekly Hours:  40  Role Number: 200306688  Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, ser- vices, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple’s Applied Machine Learning (AML) team has built diverse set of large-scale machine learning and data science Solutions. The AML Solutions team is seeking a product-minded technical program manager to deliver high-quality programs to a diverse internal teams. You will have the right mix of technical, product, and program management skills to successfully deliver complex cross-functional programs in Apple’s fast-paced environment.  Key Qualifications  Product/Program leader: Demonstrated experience in evangelizing Solutions to increase user adop- tion and engagement as well as defining strategy, roadmap, success metrics, and guide execution.  Technical breadth & depth: Possess strong technical background in cloud, big data, data science and machine learning, ideally with a background as a developer, and feel comfortable discussing tradeoffs.  Outreach skills: Adept at reaching out to varied groups of users, comfortably demo product to a wide variety of technical and non-technical users, and organize user sessions to gather specific pain points.  Communication skills: Have succinct written, verbal communication and presentation skills. Com- fortably lead senior management briefings, draft and present deliverables, recommendations and trade-offs.  Partnership & Collaboration: Have proven track record of partnering well with the key stakeholders, providing regular updates, gathering requirements, and working well with the cross-functional teams on execution plans.  Description  This role requires a combination of product and program/project management skills, strong engineer- ing background, and the ability to build collaborative relationships across various teams at Apple. A successful person in this role will be self-motivated, proactive, and action-oriented who takes the initiative to develop compelling plans, form strong teams, and persevere through obstacles to deliver on business and organizational outcomes. A person who thrives in building strong relationships with the engineering teams and business part- ners and making lasting connections. A person who can see different angles of a product/program or business opportunity, and knows how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. Sound exciting? Come join us!  Education & Experience  BS degree in computer science or equivalent field with 5+ years of professional experience, or equivalent  Additional Requirements  BA/BS in Computer Science or related field with 5+ years or equivalent experience Masters Degree in Computer Science or related fields a plus  Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

Worker Sub-Type: Regular  Job Description: *Data Scientist  This position is open to remote applicants. We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join the BlackBerry Data Science Research team. At BlackBerry we develop state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms to solve long-standing problems in computer security. We discover novel ML techniques and applications, build systems to handle petabytes of ludicrously high dimensional data, and protect people from cybersecurity threats. With machine learning at the heart of all of BlackBerry’s cybersecurity products, the Data Science Research team is a critical, highly visible, and high-impact team within the company. The team brings together experts from machine learning, stats, computer science, computer security, and various applied sciences, with backgrounds including deep learning, Bayesian statistics, time-series modeling, topology, scalable data processing, and software engineering. What you will do Invent novel machine learning techniques to tackle important problems in computer security Write code that scales to very large datasets, often with millions of dimensions and billions of rows Discover ways to strengthen machine learning models against adversarial attacks Collaborate with engineering teams to turn ML prototypes into new products or features Publish papers and present research at conferences, including ML/AI/Stats conferences, as well as security conferences like Black Hat, DEFCON, and RSA Stay abreast of the latest publications and state-of-the-art techniques in relevant research communities (e.g., ML and stats) What we’re looking for Extensive theoretical and hands-on knowledge of machine learning and deep learning Strong math skills, including statistics and linear algebra Experience with python and at least one deep learning library (e.g., pytorch or tensorflow) Excellent oral and written communication skills Master’s or PhD in a relevant field Kindness, and a deep willingness to help and collaborate with others Technologies we use Python and libraries like pytorch, tensorflow, lightgbm, xgboost, catboost, numpy, pandas, sklearn, and scipy . job_title: Manager, QA Data Analytics and Innovation Lead
job_Description: Janssen Research & Development, LLC, part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is recruiting for a  Manager, QA Data Analytics and Innovation Lead  for BioResearch Quality & Compliance (BRQC) Quality Assurance (QA) organization. This position can be based at a Janssen site in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, San Diego, CA or Beerse, Belgium.  At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Research & Development, LLC is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.  The QA Data Analytics and Innovation Lead will be a key member of the BRQC QA. QA is on a continued transformation journey to drive risk-based audit strategy and value-adding audit outcomes. This role will play a critical role in enabling QA transformation by supporting the development and execution of innovation strategies and projects focused on technology and analytics solutions. This role will lead/coordinate cross-functional teams to deliver innovation and process improvement to enhance the E2E audit process in the BRQC QA organization. The candidate will have several years of data analytics and project management experience, a demonstrated ability to build/maintain a project portfolio by identifying, validating, and leading the development of new ideas, and the capability to handle multiple projects and teams with speed, professionalism, and creative problem-solving. The QA Data Analytics and Innovation Lead is expected to regularly interact with QA Leadership, QA Operations Excellence (OPEX) leads, and domain SMEs.  In partnership with OPEX leads and domain SMEs, provides end-to-end project management and project leadership for QA innovation projects.  Responsibilities:  Technology and Data analytics:  Liaise and partner with Quality Analytics (QANA), IT, Data science teams to communicate QA audit-related needs and to drive adoption, application, and implementation of risk-based audits, efficiency tools, automation, and other technology applications within QA.  Partner with QA domains to identify and implement transformative audit methodologies applying technology and AI-based data analytics strategies (e.g., machine learning, deep learning, NLP, etc.) to gain deep insights into pre-clinical, clinical, and PV compliance.  Enable improved data management and dedicated analysis of multiple data sources to predict or identify trends to enhance audit scoping, dedicated communications to business partners, etc.  Assure optimal use of the technology and infrastructure currently available for QA to improve efficiency in audit conduct, audit reporting, and audit trend analysis.  Partner within the QA OPEX team members and with QANA and Quality Management (QM) to adopt new capabilities/tools and new ways of working effectively.  Develop and maintain data-focused audit analysis and operational metrics in support of various strategy and compliance forums.  Coordinate and lead QA efforts in metrics generation to support QSMR, Aggregate Analysis, and other compliance and strategy forums.  Innovation Projects Leadership:  Contributes to shaping innovation strategies/projects to enable QA domain audit strategy transformation or overall business process enhancement.  Leads project teams and oversees all phases of the project from initiation to post-implementation to ensure adoption of technology and tools and improve value creation (e.g., ideates and prioritizes technology solutions, builds business cases, develops project plan, gathers user requirements, facilitates whiteboard sessions, manages project execution, supports compliance analysis and risk assessment, supports UAT, training, change management, and post-deployment hyper-care activities, etc.). Maintains a portfolio tracker to manage projects effectively, communicates innovation efforts via proper forums, and closely partners with domains to drive QA transformations.  Provides ongoing coaching to QA colleagues in innovation to enable more effective and efficient execution of projects.  May lead other projects and/or continuous improvement efforts for QA. Support other innovation activities for QA as needed.  QA audit base business: Support audits and/or related activities as needed.   Qualifications Required:  Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in a STEM field e.g., Computer Science, other quantitative sciences, Information/Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics/Statistics).  Minimum of 8 years of business-related experience.  Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analytics or data science.  Experience developing and working with database and reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, AWS) and programming experience in a modern data science language (Python or R).  Experience leading cross-functional technical/business teams or projects.  This position may require up to 10% domestic and international travel.  Preferred:  Experience in Automation and Machine Learning.  Experience in R&D Quality and Compliance.  Experience leading large-scale projects to successful implementation. ABOUT VAYNERMEDIA VaynerMedia is a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.  The VP, Data & Analytics will be a leader in analytics for VaynerMedia LA (VMLA), bringing actionable and inspiring insights from all data sources to promote and enable data-driven strategies and decision-making across all VMLA clients. Someone who is in love with connecting social data with business results, to help steer the social marketing direction of our Fortune 500 brand roster.  The ideal VaynerMedia VP, Data & Analytics doesn't just love numbers, they love using them to tell stories and provide actionable recommendations. We're looking for someone with analytical rigor, innovation around campaign and media analytics, customer insights, and business intelligence for VMLA clients.  The Task At Hand:   Responsible for the quality of all analytics deliverables across the team and being a leader within the agency, ensuring that VaynerMedia is driving value for clients.  Drive scoping efforts for both new and existing clients ensuring team profitability and utilization.  Work as lead client contact for all analytics and business intelligence for VMLA clients. This includes pushing the client forward in using data driven intelligence through clear POVs and presentations as well as continual conversations around the uses of data analysis for decision-making processes.  Oversee all ongoing relationships and deliverables with day-to-day clients to ensure quality and alignment to clients' goals.  Identify and nurture opportunities to increase or expand scope for both the analytics team and the wider agency.  Analyze complex systems to discern insights, drive solutions and deliver effective and efficient marketing investments to help clients connect more directly and efficiently with their customers and meet their business objectives.  Use data and emerging technologies to help clients find and reach their best prospects, learn from experiments, measure/optimize their promotional investments, predict future behavior, build models for forecasting, and multi-touch point marketing programs across all forms of media.  Effectively simplify findings, enabling others to comprehend complex ideas and concepts.  Provide accurate attribution platforms/models across multiple media channels  Author of VMLA's POVs on trends and developments in marketing analytics, big data and data science  Develop and implement digital ecosystem measurement and insights  Provide overall leadership, guidance & mentorship to the analytics team and help build a world class team of data scientists capable of meeting the needs of VMLA clients.     The Ideal Candidate Has:   10+ years of experience working in digital analytical fields, with a record of accomplishment in achieving desired business results through process optimization.  Extensive working knowledge in Modeling, Forecasting, & Data Management.  Preferred specialties include data science, big data, data-driven decisions, online services analytics, modeling and analysis, product innovation, leadership and operational strength  Results-focused, driven by the desire to make marketing go further, faster and better than before using technology, analytics and insights  Extensive working knowledge in database marketing principles & digital analytics (site analytics, social, EM, online)  Extensive working knowledge of basic analytic tools, with advanced experience in Excel and Python.  Demonstrates ability to multi-task in a fast-paced data environment.  Possesses exceptional written and verbal communication skills.  Strong leadership skills with a desire to build and develop the team.  Proven track record of managing multiple projects at once.  Analytics Disciplines: General Analytics, Media Buying, Adtech, Martech, Research, Statistics/Machine Learning/Programming.

Engineering - Mountain View, CA - Manager  About us: Didi Chuxing  (“DiDi”) is the world’s leading mobile transportation and convenience platform! The company offers a full range of app-based transportation and life services for over 550 million users across Asia, Latin America, Australia, and Russia, including Taxi, Express, Premier, Luxe, Bus, Designated Driving, Enterprise Solutions, Bike Sharing, E-bike Sharing, Automobile Solutions, Food Delivery, and Payment. Tens of millions of drivers who find flexible work opportunities on the DiDi platform provide over 10 billion passenger trips a year.  DiDi is committed to collaborating with policymakers, the taxi industry, the automobile industry, and communities to solve the world’s transportation, and environmental, and employment challenges with localized smart transportation innovations by leveraging its AI capabilities. By continuously improving user experience and creating social value, DiDi strives to build a safe, inclusive, and sustainable mobile transportation and convenience ecosystem for cities of the future. For more information, please visit: www.didiglobal.com/news Team Introduction The International Business Technology Team is responsible for expanding DiDi’s global footprint and establishing DiDi’s global presence. This effort will leverage existing application and service infrastructure to build DiDi’s overseas products. Our team will be the vanguard of DiDi’s international expansion initiative. Here you will work to elevate the experiences of our global customers, improve DiDi’s operational and marketplace efficiency and build the products that will continue to change the global transportation landscape. Responsibilities: Participate in design, architecture, implementation, and support of machine learning systems behind the related products, including pricing, incentives, recommendation systems, ranking, etc. Implement and productionize machine learning models and optimization algorithms designed by data scientists. Basic knowledge of classical machine learning algorithms. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Can work in a fast-paced environment. Bonus Points: Experience with Flink and/or Spark streaming. Experience with building deep learning systems and familiar with a DL framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch). Experience working in a product and/or business-driven environment. Engineering experience with recommendation systems and ranking. Engineering experience with online learning and/or reinforcement learning.
